quote-source: Francisco X. AlarcÃ³n, Prayer, From the Other Side of Night/Del otro lado de la noche (University of Arizona Press, 2002)
quote-text:
I want a god
as my accomplice
who spends nights
in houses
of ill repute
and gets up late
on Saturdays

a god
who whistles
through the streets
and trembles
before the lips
of his lover

[…]

a god
who pisses
out of fear
before the flaring
electrodes
of torture

a god
who hurts
to the last
bone and
bites the air
in pain
